title: Insecure Default Variable Initialization
overview: The software, by default, initializes an internal variable with an insecure or less secure value than is possible.
remediation: ::PHASE:System Configuration:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Disable or change default settings when they can be used to abuse the system. Since those default settings are shipped with the product they are likely to be known by a potential attacker who is familiar with the product. For instance, default credentials should be changed or the associated accounts should be disabled.::
